oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Hood, Ralph W.; Williamson, W. Paul (William Paul)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Video recording of a service opening with the testimony of Bill Pelfrey. He addresses the assembly and asks them to only do what makes them comfortable, and not to risk injury unless they are sure of their actions. He calls the congregation to separate by gender and come to the left and right of the altar an pray. Billy Lemming sings and plays guitar. He is followed by Bill Pelfrey who gives a sermon to those assembled. He calls Brenda Brown and Diane Tucker to the pulpit and they sing. Carl Porter testifies, sings, and handles a serpent. The serpent bites Pastor Porter, but Porter continues to sing. When he leaves the pulpit, Bill Pelfrey announces that he is well, but asks people to continue to pray for him. Brenda Brown and Diane Tucker follow him in singing. Sister Pelfrey speaks in tongues.
